0.Summary: "It has been a wonderful place to learn how to run a business, from the ground up."
0.Pros: Stability, consistent pay, paid time off, fun atmosphere. The owner of the company really takes the time to help you grow, and offers many classes to learn.
0.Cons: Stress of handling fifty things at one time, with a smile on your face. There are days when you are expected to do entirely too much (superhuman)

1.Pros: Ton of hours, Management was great
1.Cons: Scheduling was all over the place, but still manageable

2.Cons: The cons are the inconsistency between managers

3.Pros: I was given a free meal as part of my break and I came to enjoy working with my co-workers (they renovated our restaurant).
3.Cons: Rude customers and very very poor management. There was a huge lack of organization and it made it difficult to feel like you wanted to stick around.

4.Summary: "Good as a first job, but not much else"
4.Pros: McDonald's offer flexible hours and is a very solid first job for those in high school or college. Crew is very friendly and upbeat.
4.Cons: Work is very physical and fast paced, so it is not meant for everyone. Minimum wage to begin with, with small bi-yearly raises. Frequently asked to work extra.

5.Cons: Sometimes get too overwhelmed when there's too many customers and not enough people working

6.Pros: Good Benefits, Good fun, and you learn a lot
6.Cons: Hard to develop, grow and promote with the company unless you have no other commitments.

7.Cons: Drama and negative energy towards crrw.

8.Pros: Good for a first job to gain some experience, not where I'd like to work long term
8.Cons: Low Pay, not where I would like to work long term by any means

9.Pros: food is awesome! people are nice. i learned a lot. the clientele are nice people too. great place to work. that's all i have to say
9.Cons: sometimes i would eat too much mcdonalds before or after my shift and I would get burnt out on it. Also, i really wish that the mcrib was all year round on the menu
